title: BlackRock files for spot Ethereum ETF with SEC - The Block
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has filed for a spot Ethereum ETF with the SEC, seeking to track the price of ether. The ETF, called iShares Ethereum Trust, has selected Coinbase Custody Trust Company as its custodian and the CME CF Bitcoin Reference Rate as its benchmark. This comes after BlackRock filed for a spot Bitcoin ETF in June, which is currently awaiting SEC approval. Big trading firms are reportedly in talks to provide liquidity for BlackRock's proposed spot bitcoin ETF if it obtains regulatory approval. The price of ether jumped nearly 2% on the news of the ETF filing.

title: BlackRock files for spot Ethereum ETF with U.S. regulators - ReadWrite
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has filed an application with the SEC for an exchange-traded fund (ETF) that would directly hold Ethereum, the second-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization. The proposed ETF, called the iShares Ethereum Trust, aims to track the price of Ethereum similarly to how gold ETFs track the price of gold. This filing comes after BlackRock filed for a spot bitcoin ETF earlier this year, which is still awaiting approval. The ETF could provide mainstream investors with easy access to Ethereum through traditional brokerage accounts, but the SEC has rejected several bitcoin ETF applications in the past due to concerns over volatility and potential manipulation in the underlying crypto markets. BlackRock's filing suggests the company sees potential for an SEC approval soon, given the maturation of the Ethereum market and increasing client interest in crypto. Approval of a spot Bitcoin or Ethereum ETF could unlock significant institutional demand and provide regulatory clarity, which BlackRock's size and influence

title: BlackRock applies for spot Ethereum ETF - crypto.news
summary: BlackRock has filed an application with the SEC to create a spot Ethereum ETF, with the goal of "broadly reflecting the price performance of Ethereum." This comes after the company registered the iShares Ethereum Trust with the Delaware Division of Corporations and the Nasdaq exchange applied to register the proposed exchange-traded fund. The news has led to a nearly 1.4% increase in Ethereum's price. Additionally, the SEC has postponed decisions on applications for Bitcoin and Ethereum futures ETFs.

title: BlackRock Ethereum ETF Filing Prompts Quick ETH Price Reaction - Milk Road
summary: BlackRock, a major asset manager, has filed an application with the SEC for a spot Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF) that would track the price of Ether. The proposed ETF, called the iShares Ethereum Trust, would be benchmarked against the CME CF Ether Reference Rate and custodied by Coinbase Custody Trust. The news caused a near 2% increase in Ether's price, but it quickly dropped back down. BlackRock is also seeking approval for a spot bitcoin ETF, and major trading firms are reportedly preparing to support it. The SEC has yet to approve any spot crypto ETFs, but BlackRock's filings signal its intent to lead the industry in this area as universal adoption momentum builds.

title: BlackRock Files Spot Ethereum ETF Application with SEC - Decrypt
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has filed an S-1 registration for a spot Ethereum ETF with the SEC. The ETF aims to track the price of Ethereum and will be custodied by Coinbase. This follows BlackRock's previous application for a spot Bitcoin ETF, which was rejected by the SEC. The filing comes as Ethereum's price stands at $2,069, up 2.7% on the day. The SEC has yet to confirm whether Ethereum is considered a security or a commodity under its regulations.

title: Ethereum L2 Starknet aims to decentralize core components of its scaling network - Cointelegraph
summary: Starknet, an Ethereum layer-2 scaling network, aims to decentralize three core components of its zero-knowledge (ZK) proof rollup solution to improve security and robustness. Starknet operates as a validity rollup using ZK-proof technology to bundle transactions and submit cryptographic proofs to Ethereum for security and finality. While Starkware, the firm behind Starknet, remains a centralized gateway for entering the network, it cannot steal money or perform invalid state transitions due to Ethereum's layer-1 blockchain. Starknet aims to decentralize block production, the proving layer, and the process of L1 state updates to achieve full decentralization. Decentralizing these components will require varying degrees of difficulty and will be tested through a series of interconnected testnets.

title: Coinbase launches new protocol to improve Commerce, supports Ethereum, Polygon and Base - The Block
summary: Coinbase has launched an open-source "Onchain Payment Protocol" to improve its Commerce product, which now supports Ethereum, Polygon, and Base blockchain ecosystems. The protocol aims to provide instant settlement, low fees, and broad asset support, making it easier for merchants to accept crypto payments. The update also helps merchants avoid crypto volatility by automatically converting customers' crypto to the USDC stablecoin. Coinbase has also announced that it will support more networks in the future.

title: Dogecoin Leaves Bitcoin, Ethereum In The Dust After This Space Company Literally Plans To Take It 'To The Moon' - Nasdaq
summary: Dogecoin (DOGE) has surged 5% in value despite a flat cryptocurrency market, driven by an announcement that it will be sent to the moon aboard a lunar lander. Astrobotic, a space robotics company, will transport a physical representation of DOGE to the moon as part of its Peregrine Lunar Lander mission, funded by the Dogecoin community in 2015. This mission embodies the collective effort of the Dogecoin community. The decision to send DOGE to the moon is a literal translation of the popular 'To the Moon' rallying cry within the cryptocurrency community. On-chain analytics firm Santiment reports that DOGE has seen a notable amount of long positions opening as traders bet on price increases. At the time of writing, DOGE is trading at $0.081, up 5.33% in the last 24 hours.

title: Cardano's Hydra and Ethereum's Plasma: Who Copied Who? - CCN.com
summary: Cardano's Hydra and Ethereum's Plasma are two scaling solutions being developed to address the issue of slow transaction times on blockchain networks. While both solutions share some similarities, they have distinct architectures and security assumptions. Cardano's Hydra uses state channels to manage security and state progression between channel participants, while Plasma uses sidechains to move data and computation off the main chain. Ethereum's latest proposal for Plasma includes improvements using zero-knowledge proofs, which could resolve issues around data availability and withdrawal game complexity. The debate around copying between the two projects highlights the ongoing quest for scalability solutions in the blockchain and crypto industry.

title: MEV Explained: The Invisible Force Driving Ethereum! - hackernoon.com
summary: In a recent article on Hackernoon, Adam Boudj explains the concept of MEV (Maximum Extractable Value) and its role in driving the Ethereum ecosystem. MEV refers to the maximum amount of value that can be extracted from a smart contract without compromising its security. The invisible force of MEV drives the development of decentralized applications (dApps) and the growth of the Ethereum network. Understanding MEV is crucial for developers, investors, and users of the Ethereum ecosystem.

title: ETH Soars as BlackRock Files for Ethereum Spot ETF with SEC - U.Today
summary: BlackRock, a large investment management firm, has filed an application with the SEC to launch a spot Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF). This news has caused the price of Ethereum (ETH) to surge, reaching $2,079 at the time of writing. BlackRock had previously filed a similar application through Nasdaq, which led to a price increase for ETH. The SEC is currently reviewing around a dozen spot Bitcoin ETF requests, including BlackRock's, and has delayed decisions on three of them. Despite some delays, the price of Bitcoin (BTC) reached a high of $37,774 on Wednesday.

title: What Is Validium in Ethereum? A Beginner's Guide - Unchained - Unchained
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Validium is a L2 scaling solution for Ethereum that uses zk-proofs to verify off-chain transactions, improving scalability, privacy, and security. It bundles sidechain transactions into batches and generates zk-proofs for each batch, which are then submitted to the Ethereum mainnet for verification. Validium can handle thousands of transactions per second, making it ideal for high-throughput applications like DeFi and gaming platforms. It also reduces transaction fees and speeds, making Ethereum more affordable and efficient. However, Validium also has challenges and limitations, such as centralization concerns and dependence on data providers. Despite these challenges, Validium is an innovative solution that can redefine the Ethereum network's experience.

title: Solana Price Outperforms Bitcoin, Others as Cathie Wood Rates it Higher Than Ethereum - CCN.com
summary: Cathie Wood, CEO of ARK Invest, has praised Solana's performance, citing its faster transaction speeds and lower costs compared to Ethereum. Solana's native token, SOL, has surged over 400% in 2023, reaching new highs. Wood believes Solana is a crucial infrastructure component in the blockchain ecosystem and has highlighted its potential for real-world applications. However, she cautions against focusing solely on short-term price movements and emphasizes the importance of staying focused on Bitcoin's long-term potential. Solana's price has spiked 20% after Wood's comments, and some speculate it may reach $80 by the end of the week.

title: BlackRock filing confirms Ethereum ETF plan with Coinbase as custodian - DLNews
summary: BlackRock has filed an S-1 prospectus for a spot Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF) with Coinbase as the custodian. The filing is a key step towards the ETF's launch, which would provide US investors with exposure to Ether without the need for crypto-specific infrastructure. BlackRock has already established a strategic partnership with Coinbase and is using the exchange as the custodian for its iShares Bitcoin spot ETF, which is currently in review by the SEC. Other financial firms have also filed Ethereum spot ETF applications, and analysts at Bloomberg predict a high chance of approval before January 10.

title: Aave Companies rebrands to Avara, acquires Ethereum self-custody 'Family Wallet' - Cointelegraph
summary: Aave Companies, a decentralized finance (DeFi) group, has rebranded to Avara and acquired Ethereum self-custody wallet Family Wallet. The rebrand marks the beginning of a new era in blockchain technology, with a focus on creating products that appeal to a wide user base. Avara's founder, Stani Kulechov, notes that the company will continue to innovate in DeFi and build tools for developers while creating new, intuitive products that attract mainstream users. The acquisition of Family Wallet includes its flagship self-custodial Ethereum wallet and developer library ConnectKit, and the team will join Avara. Avara hopes to tap into the experience of building the messaging application Honk to continue the development of Lens Protocol, a social layer for the wider Web3 ecosystem.

title: BlackRock Files for a Spot Ethereum ETF With the SEC Months After Applying for a Similar Bitcoin Product - The Daily Hodl
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest investment firm, has filed for a spot Ethereum ETF with the SEC, months after applying for a similar Bitcoin product. The ETF would grant retail investors exposure to Ethereum through traditional stock exchanges, and aims to reflect the performance of the price of Ether before expenses and liabilities. This move comes after BlackRock registered an Ethereum Trust in Delaware, similar to its Bitcoin trust, and after the SEC rejected numerous attempts by other firms to create Bitcoin ETFs, but approved futures BTC ETFs. The regulatory agency has been inconsistent in its stance on approving spot market BTC ETFs, but a federal judge recently ruled that the SEC must reconsider its stance on Grayscale's BTC ETF.

title: BlackRock Officially Files for Spot Ethereum ETF - nft now
summary: BlackRock, a leading asset management firm, has filed an application with the SEC to launch a spot Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF). The proposed ETF, iShares Ethereum Trust, aims to mirror the performance of Ethereum. BlackRock has chosen Coinbase Custody Trust Company as the custodian and CME CF Bitcoin Reference Rate as the ETF benchmark. The filing comes after BlackRock registered the iShares Ethereum Trust entity with the Delaware Department of State Division of Corporations and follows the recent court rulings that have fueled optimism for potential approvals. Other ETF prospects are also being considered, including a spot Bitcoin ETF application currently under review by the SEC.

title: What did we learn from BlackRock's Ethereum SEC S-1 filing today? - CryptoSlate
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has filed an S-1 registration statement and prospectus with the SEC for an Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF). The ETF, called the iShares Ethereum Trust, will directly hold Ethereum and seek to track the price of Ethereum before fees and expenses. The trust will be structured as a grantor trust and will issue shares representing fractional undivided beneficial interests in its net assets, consisting primarily of Ethereum. The management fee and additional expenses will be left blank in the current filing. The ETF will periodically sell Ethereum to cover fees, creating taxable events for shareholders. The sponsor has discretion over how to handle network forks, airdrops, and other events that may entitle it to new assets. The ETF plans to list on the Nasdaq under an unnamed ticker and will continuously issue shares to authorized participants in exchange for Ethereum deposits. No launch date is provided.

title: BlackRock Files for a Spot Ethereum ETF - Watcher Guru
summary: BlackRock, a $9 trillion asset manager, has filed for an S-1 application for a Spot Ethereum ETF. If approved, BlackRock will offer Ethereum ETF services to institutional clients, potentially leading to increased investment in the cryptocurrency market. The development could drive up the prices of Ethereum and Bitcoin, with institutional investors viewing Ethereum as the new silver and Bitcoin as the new gold. The last time BlackRock received SEC approval for a Spot Gold ETF in 2004, gold prices surged nearly 350%.

title: Spot Ethereum ETF: BlackRock Files For Spot Ethereum ETF, ETH Price To Rally? - CoinGape

title: Former advisor Steven Nerayoff hypes Ethereum scandal exposé - Protos
summary: Steven Nerayoff, a former legal advisor to the Ethereum Foundation, has made several claims about Ethereum's early days, including that Vitalik Buterin asked him to help rescue the Ethereum Foundation and that he invented the idea of issuing utility tokens through ICOs. Nerayoff also alleges that the Ethereum Foundation and Slock.it were behind the hack of The DAO, and that the SEC, DoJ, and FBI fabricated charges against him. Additionally, Nerayoff and TruthLabs have questioned Ethereum's decentralization and called out ex-SEC Director Bill Hinman for potential conflicts of interest. Finally, Nerayoff claims that Vitalik Buterin could have shorted Ethereum at some point. However, it's important to note that these are just allegations and have not been proven in court.

This filing marks the beginning of the institutional rush into cryptocurrency-based spot ETFs, as the crypto market recovers from the last bear market.

title: What is Plasma and why is Vitalik Buterin into it all over again? - Blockworks
summary:
Vitalik Buterin is reviving the Plasma scaling solution for Ethereum as a way to reduce transaction fees without compromising security. Plasma networks are "child" chains of the Ethereum mainnet that execute transactions off-chain and periodically post final states back to the mainnet. This approach reduces the amount of data that needs to be stored on-chain, making it less costly and time-consuming for network participants to verify transactions. However, the previous implementation of Plasma, known as Plasma Cash, had issues with misbehaving operators and defragmentation protocols.

To address these concerns, Buterin is proposing the use of zk-SNARKS and validity proofs to prove the validity of each Plasma block without revealing the contents of the transactions. This would allow for instant withdrawals and eliminate the need for complex ownership structures. However, there are still limitations to the Plasma design, such as the challenge of handling state objects without clear economic owners.

Buterin believes that Plasma remains an underrated design in the blockchain technology space and could help ease Ethereum transaction fees. While roll-ups are the

title: Ethereum Slammed as Cardano Wannabe by Former ETH Advisor - DailyCoin
summary: Former Ethereum advisor Steven Nerayoff has accused the project of copying Cardano's approach to scaling, claiming that Ethereum's decision to ditch Charles Hoskinson was a "major mistake." Nerayoff has also accused Ethereum of being a fraudulent project with corrupt ties to federal agencies. Meanwhile, Cardano YODA has pointed out similarities between Ethereum's Plasma proposal and Cardano's Hydra scaling approach. While Ethereum has more real-world adoption and deployed dApps, Cardano's methodical approach may ultimately prevail. The accusations of fraud against Ethereum refuse to fade away, casting a shadow of uncertainty over the project, especially in light of the FTX scandal.

title: Grayscale ETH futures ETF a 'trojan horse' for spot Ethereum ETF: Analyst - Cointelegraph
summary: Grayscale Investments is using its Ether (ETH) futures exchange-traded fund (ETF) application as a "trojan horse" to pressure the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) into approving its spot Ether ETF, according to Bloomberg ETF analyst James Seyffart. If the SEC approves Grayscale's application, it could pave the way for the approval of its spot Ether ETF. However, if the SEC denies the bid, Grayscale could argue that the SEC is treating Bitcoin (BTC) and Ether futures ETFs differently, which could be seen as unfair. Seyffart and other analysts believe that the SEC's delay in making a decision on Grayscale's Ether futures ETF is a sign that the regulator is struggling to reconcile the differences between spot and futures ETFs.

title: Aave rebrands to Avara, acquires software developer behind Ethereum wallet Family - The Block
summary: Aave, a blockchain technology firm, has rebranded to Avara and acquired a Los Angeles-based web3 startup, Los Feliz Engineering, behind the Ethereum crypto wallet Family and developer library ConnectKit. The acquisition marks Avara's second purchase, expanding its ecosystem of Lens, a decentralized social media platform. Benji Taylor, the founder of Family, will join Avara as senior vice president of product and design. The entire Los Feliz engineering team will also join Avara. Avara's transformation and integration of Family are significant steps towards its ultimate mission of an open, decentralized internet.

BlackRock CEO Larry Fink views Bitcoin's price rally as a sign of "pent-up interest in crypto," but the update has failed to catalyze ETH price gains so far.

A total of 9,999 Warlords NFTs will be made, with 8,000 available through the mint and 1,000 reserved for the Oasys community. Ubisoft will also keep 999 NFTs for future marketing purposes and giveaways. The company is encouraging Twitter users to like, retweet, and comment on their announcement tweet to be added to the allowlist to mint the NFTs. title: BlackRock Ventures into Ethereum with New ETF Filing - Crypto Times
summary: BlackRock, a leading asset manager, has filed for an Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF) with the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This marks BlackRock's expansion into the crypto space and could have significant implications for the broader market. The proposed ETF, called iShares Ethereum Trust, aims to replicate the price movement of ether. The SEC is reviewing several spot bitcoin ETF applications, including BlackRock's, and major trading firms are reportedly preparing to provide liquidity for the anticipated spot bitcoin ETF. This development highlights the growing recognition of digital assets as a valuable component of diversified investment portfolios.

title: Why Cathie Wood Is Bullish on Solana - Decrypt
summary: Cathie Wood, CEO of ARK Invest, is bullish on Solana due to its efficiency and cost-effectiveness compared to Ethereum. Solana saw a 15% price increase after Wood's comments and has gained an additional $10 since then, reaching $62 according to CoinGecko. Wood has previously praised Solana's efficiency and potential to outpace Ethereum, despite regulatory hurdles in the US. She projects the cryptocurrency market could grow to $25 trillion by 2030 with institutional adoption driving growth.

title: Ethereum Insider Big Reveal Expected To Happen Today, Here’s What You Should Know | Bitcoinist.com - Bitcoinist
summary: Ethereum insider Steven Nerayoff is set to reveal evidence of fraud accusations against Ethereum founders Vitalik Buterin and Joseph Lubin today. Nerayoff has promised to release several documents and a possibly damning recording of a conversation between him and Buterin. The insider has been accusing the founders of fraud for months, but they have remained silent, leading Nerayoff to challenge their silence. The Ethereum price has fallen to $2,039 in response to the news.

title: Solana Vs. Ethereum: Helius CEO Outlines Why SOL Is Superior - Bitcoinist
summary: Solana (SOL) is gaining ground in the blockchain space, with CEO Mert Mumtaz highlighting several key performance aspects where Solana outperforms Ethereum (ETH). Solana has consistently achieved higher transaction speeds, with an average of 400 milliseconds compared to Ethereum's 15 minutes. Additionally, Solana's transaction fees are significantly lower, averaging $0.00025 compared to Ethereum's range of $1.5 to $20. Solana's network size is also smaller than Ethereum's, with approximately 3,000 nodes compared to 8,000 nodes. While Ethereum is more decentralized, Mumtaz questions the practical impact of this difference beyond a certain threshold, suggesting that balance is needed between decentralization and performance. Joe McCann of Asymmetric highlights data from Galaxy Digital that shows Solana's growing prominence in the decentralized finance (DeFi) sector, with Solana representing 1.15% of all active DeFi addresses, significantly ahead of Ethereum and other Layer
